Digital fundus photography is recommended now to assess for any signs of diabetic retinopathy, which can be an early indicator of diabetes. Yearly follow-up is also recommended to monitor for progression of diabetic retinopathy. Albumin-to-creatinine ratio and monofilament test are used to assess for diabetic kidney disease and peripheral neuropathy, respectively, and are typically done after a longer duration (about 5 years) of diabetes. Fasting lipid profile is also important for cardiovascular risk assessment but should be done more frequently (every 1-2 years) for high-risk individuals.
